column1: #Text=Mugabe is ' prepared to fight ' if Zimbabwe elects opposition

#Text=Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe , who is slated to face opposition leader Morgan Tsvangirai in a run-off election on June 27 , said today that the opposition would never govern Zimbabwe as long as he is alive , vowing to " go to war " if the Movement for Democratic Change ( MDC ) wins the election .
#Text=" We shall never , never accept anything that smells of ... the MDC .

#Text= It shall never happen ... as long as we are alive and those who fought for the country are alive , " he added .

column1: #Text=" We are prepared to fight for our country and to go to war for it .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=He described Tsvangirai and the opposition as  traitors " and characterized them as puppets of Great Britain and the " white man " , who ruled Zimbabwe until the country gained independence in 1980 .

column1: #Text=" This country shall not again come under the rule and control of the white man , direct or indirect , " Mugabe said .
#Text=Mugabe accused British Prime Minister Gordon Brown of interfering in Zimbabwe 's affairs , after Brown called for " free and fair elections " and " an end to violence " on Friday .
#Text=" We have become the focus of the British and the Americans .

#Text= It is clearly impossible to talk about a free and fair election in Zimbabwe , " the MDC said following Tsvangirai 's arrest .

column1: #Text=" To suggest otherwise is to be clearly blind to the grave harassment , intimidation and violence that the people of Zimbabwe have had to endure over the past few years .

#Text=Prosecutors said they planned to charge him with treason , for proclaiming victory in the March election before official results were announced and for  publishing a document that was explaining a transitional strategy around March 26 " .

column1: #Text=Biti 's lawyer says these charges could carry a death penalty .

#Text=On Friday , forty prominent African leaders , including former UN Secretaries-General Kofi Annan and Boutros Boutros-Ghali , criticized the government of Zimbabwe in an open letter , demanding an end to acts of " intimidation , harassment and violence " .

column1: #Text=Meanwhile , Mugabe said that veterans of Zimbabwe 's liberation war would be willing to take up arms in order to prevent the opposition from coming into power .
